Expert: Rick Dudasik - 4/19/2002
Question I am considering developing a five unit building suited for fast food establishments. I am concerned about the success of such a development project. What issues might I run up against when trying to have five fast food restaurants in one location? What type of traffic counts should I be looking for? The location is located 3/10ths of a mile from a corner with 19,000 cars/day count. Demographics within 5 miles...28,500 homes, average houshold income $35,000-$75,000. Young families make up the majority of the demo.
Also, what percentage of revenue is attributed to rent? For a store doing $350k anually, is $36K in rent to high?
Thanks for the advice!!
Answer Dear Kyle,
In response to your questions, first of all, from the description you gave, you have a great location.
My advise is to stick with the big players, No "mom and Pop" places....way too risky!
Typicaly rent is in the 10% range. However, the big guys like an Applebees or Fridays, can do 1.5 to 2.5 million in sales per year!
When you start dealing with these guys, it is best to get a broker on your side, as it can get quite involved.
Hope this helps you a little,
Best of luck on your development Rick Dudasik
